member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.AccessDeniedException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown if access is denied.
member.remarks:
There are two kinds of access denied scenarios. In both cases this exception is thrown, but with different error codes.
Attempt to log in with a user which doesn't have access to the system.
Attempt to perform an action for which the user doesn't have permissions.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.KernelException
member.summary: Base class for exceptions raised by the TCM Kernel.
member.remarks: This is not an abstract base class. For some specific kernel errors, specific subclasses are thrown. For all other kernel errors, instances of KernelException are thrown and the error code can be used to determine the cause of the exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the KernelException class with an inner exception.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the KernelException class with a given severity and inner exception.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.KernelException.CreateFromCOMException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Converts a COM exception raised by the TCM Kernel to an appropriate -derived instance.
member.param: The exception obtained from the legacy BL.
member.returns: An instance of or of a subclass or the original exception.
member.remarks: Since communication with the BL occurs through COM interop, all errors raised in the BL/DAL will enter .NET as COM exceptions with TCM error XML as the exception message. This method determines if a COM exception represents such a TCM Kernel error and, if so, convert it to a or one of it's subclasses (based on the error code). If the COM exception does not represent a TCM Kernel error, the original exception is returned.

member.name: M:Tridion.ContentManager.KernelException.CreateFromCOMException(System.Exception,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a COM exception raised by the TCM Kernel to an appropriate -derived instance.
member.param: The exception obtained from the legacy BL.
The error message obtained from the legacy BL. If null, the error message is obtained from the exception.
The error code obtained from the legacy BL. If 0, the error code is obtained from the exception.
member.returns: An instance of or of a subclass or the original exception.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.KernelException.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the frames on the call stack at the time the current exception was thrown.
member.remarks: This method is overridden to include an optional stack trace obtained from the legacy BL.

member.name: P:Tridion.ContentManager.KernelException.LegacyCallStack
member.summary: Gets the call stack as obtained from the legacy BL.
member.value: If a legacy call stack is present, the value contains one array element per "stack frame". Otherwise, the value is null.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode
member.summary: Specifies what will happen to the child nodes of a Taxonomy node after that node's deletion.

remarks.para: Using , nodes in child Publications that are part of the branch will not be deleted. If a child node has other parents that are not part of the branch, the child node and its children will not be deleted. .
Using , if a child node has other parents that are not part of the branch, the child node and its children will not be deleted. .

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.DeleteBranch
member.summary: Specifies that the entire branch of descendant nodes will be deleted, excluding nodes in child Publications.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.DeleteBranchIncludeChildPublications
member.summary: Specifies that the entire branch of descendants will be deleted, including nodes in child Publications.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.RemoveParentFromChildren
member.summary: Specifies that the deleted node will be removed from the children's parents. Children will become root if they have no other parents. If the children have other parents, those parents are preserved.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.DeleteTaxonomyNodeMode.AssignChildrenToGrandparents
member.summary: Specifies that the parents of the deleted node adopt the deleted node's children. If the children have other parents, those parents are preserved.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType
member.summary: Defines the state (lock) of an item.
member.remarks: This is a set of flags, so combinations of the values are possible.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.None
member.summary: The item is not locked.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.CheckedOut
member.summary: The item is checked-out. This can mean either a temporary (edit) lock, a permanent lock (explicit check-out performed by user) or a workflow lock.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.Permanent
member.summary: The item is permanently locked, that is using an explicit lock (check-out) action. Can be applied to versioned items (permanent check-out) and to organizational items.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.NewItem
member.summary: The item is a new item, that is it has been created, but not checked-in for the first time yet.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.InWorkflow
member.summary: The item is in a workflow.

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.Reserved
member.summary: The item is reserved by the system. This means it is checked-out/locked, but nobody owns the lock.
member.remarks: Versioned Items get in this reserved state when they are checked-in, but a Bundle Process constraint exists or when they are in workflow without a lock owner (because the Activity is in Assigned state or the performer of the Activity can't read the item).

member.name: F:Tridion.ContentManager.ContentManagement.LockType.UnknownByClient
member.summary: Special reserved value used to notify a legacy client about receiving an enumeration value added in a newer version of the service. Explicitly setting this value by a client is not allowed (it can only be set internally by the service), but client code should check it and be able to handle such cases.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.ItemTypeClass
member.summary: Defines the "class" of item types.
member.remarks: The enumeration is a peculiar kind of Flags enumeration (bit map). Because there are too many item types to fit in a 32 bit integer, item types have been classified. Two bits (bit values 0x10000 and 0x20000) in the item type value represent the "class" of item type. These "class bits" are combined with one other bit to come to an item type value. Only item types value for item types within the same class can be safely OR-ed together.

member.name: T:Tridion.ContentManager.Security.Rights
member.summary: Specifies the Rights used for security checks.

remarks.para:
Using allows the user to:
Create, update and delete ProcessDefinitions.
Localize and UnLocalize ProcessDefinitions.
Associate Process Definition for items that supports workflow e.g. Component, Page, Page Template, Component Template and Bundle. Process Definition can be associated from Publication (for Templates), Structure Group (for Pages) or Schema (for Components and Bundles).

member.summary: Checks if the given Uri represents an Identifiable Object of a specific item type. If not, the will be filled with an error message that identified the problem.
member.param: Determines whether a null or value is valid or not
The item type that the given Uri must specify
The error message that describes the reason why the Uri is not valid. If the Uri is valid, this parameter will be set to null.

The method doesn't check if the object actually exists. The Uri can be invalid in the following cases:
is false and the given Uri is null or .
The Uri's item type is not equal to .
The Uri is a System Wide Object's Uri and publication part is pointing to a specific publication.
The Uri is a Non System Wide Object's Uri and publication part is pointing to System Wide Repository (0).
